```js
    > var log =
    console.log.bind(console);   
    > var ar = ['itsy', 'bitsy',
      'spider'];   
    > ar.forEach(log);   
     itsy      0   ["itsy", 
     "bitsy", "spider"]   
     bitsy    1   ["itsy", 
     "bitsy", "spider"] 
     spider  2   ["itsy", 
    "bitsy", "spider"]   

```

```js
const arr = ['a', 'b', 'c'];
arr.fill(7)
[ 7, 7, 7 ]
You can specify start and end ranges.
['a', 'b', 'c'].fill(7, 1, 2)
[ 'a', 7, 'c' ]
```

```js
    > Math.random();   
    0.8279076443185321   
    For an random integer in a range,
     say between 10 and 100:   
    > Math.round(Math.random() * 90   + 10);   
    79   

```
